subject: Mascot short URLs being ignored
description:
I can confirm that there is a wildcard rule in the Redirects file that sends all requests for URLs with paths that begin with 'mascots' (except mascotsong) to /games/mascots/index.php.

There was clearly once a reason for this. I am not sure if this catch-all redirect is still required, but if it is commented out then the URLs like /mascotsfrench /mascotsmandarin, /mascottourcomp will start working.

comments.value:

Line 102 in the redirects file: RewriteRule ^mascot(.*)$ /games/mascots/index.php [L]

subject: Monitoring of CMS to Map connections
description:
Russ asked "how do we know that the CMS is not communicating with the Map box? Should there not be some kind of monitoring or report to say that there are x requests that have been waiting y days to update"

We have a queue of map objects, we can create a process to check to see if we have any map objects sitting in a queue that are more than a day old and send an email if their are.

Should talk around a day to set something like this up, let us know if we should progress.

comments.value:

We have a queue of map objects, we can create a process to check to see if we have any map objects sitting in a queue that are more than a day old and send an email if their are.

Should talk around a day to set something like this up, let us know if we should progress.

Jamie - think that this will be money well spent to do this going forwards.

Approved.

Russ

Sorry Wahome, that's not what it is.
The GDP search api appears to somewhat randomly return either 15, 18 or 1 result!
I have a local script that reproduces it by making repeated calls to
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011
sometimes it returns 15 results, sometimes 18, and sometimes 1 result.
Interestingly, when it returns 1 result, that result is titleId=9000961547 which doesn't even exist in the feed from GDP (hence the frontend /saying/ 1 result, but displaying none).
Please can the following be forwarded to GDP?

===
The GDP search api appears to somewhat randomly return either 15, 18 or 1 result!
I have a local script that reproduces it by making repeated calls to
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011
sometimes it returns 15 results, sometimes 18, and sometimes 1 result.
Interestingly, when it returns 1 result, that result is titleId=9000961547 which doesn't even exist in the feed from GDP (hence the frontend /saying/ 1 result, but displaying none).
The test script I am running is the following which performs 20 requests, and write the responses to files named x1...x20:

#!/bin/bash
for i in {1..20}; do
  wget  -q -O x$i 'http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchLocation=so23+ohb&startDate=04%2F11%2F2011'
  echo -n "x${i}. "
  perl -n -e '/totalevents="(.*?)"/; print "Len=$1\n";' x$i
done

Sample output as follows:
x1. Len=18
x2. Len=1
x3. Len=15
x4. Len=18
x5. Len=1
x6. Len=18
x7. Len=18
x8. Len=18
x9. Len=15
x10. Len=1
x11. Len=15
x12. Len=1
x13. Len=18
x14. Len=15
x15. Len=1
x16. Len=15
x17. Len=1
x18. Len=15
x19. Len=18
x20. Len=1

I think you're using EC2; I'm wondering whether there is one or more stale instance or an instance looking at old data (or something!).

Incidentally, I just tried again, and got sensible results (Len=18, 20 times) so I thought maybe someone had fixed it. However I've just tried again and got the above results.

===
Will flag this now with Zeeshan.

Thanks Kieran. Morag - this is definitely one to bring up in the GDP
meeting today.

>

subject: Events database search interface for london2012.com

By the end of 2011 we will have a lot of additional events in the GDP database, and need to allow users to search the database and view results.

This means we need to build a front-end search and results tool within a page on london2012.com.

subject: Embedding iframe for Local Leaders
description:
We have a requirement to embed a web form as an iframe into a page on our website. Work in progress here: http://jupiter.ukdatapoint.com/wl-locog/controller.web?method=addVenueEvent

This is a web form which will allow members of the public to upload events to the Global Datapoint system, which we can review and ultimately publish via the events database. It will fit within the (coming soon) Local Leaders section of the website (in Get Involved), which will explain the campaign (getting members of the public to organise events to celebrate the Games).

We need the page with the iframe to go live on 1 December (hard deadline). We should have the final, London 2012-branded web form by 15 November, to give us time to test.

I'm hoping that's straightforward and that you have enough notice to do that. Please can you advise though on the dimensions we require for the iframe - it needs to fit within a normal content page with left-hand nav?

Thanks!

Morag

London

subject: Last bits to tie up with Learning Legacy
description:
NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED Hi both, Hope you're well? Thanks once again for all your hard work and patience with the Learning Legacy website. Everyone here is delighted with it. There are now a few last things we need to do to complete the site before I leave the ODA (in December). I have outlined the final tasks below. Please can you take a look and send over a quote for this work? I think we will need a quick chat to go through all of this in detail so that I'm as clear as I can be on what we require - how about Monday? 1. Analytics - we are being harassed about measuring the number of people visiting the site, which is absolutely something we should have thought about before. What is the cost to build the capacity to measure the number of people visiting the home page? And also another cost for the home page and theme pages? This is quite urgent, so it would be great to get this set up ASAP. 2. Accessibility - there is an issue with the accessibility style sheets, as in they don't look great. AbilityNet picked up that the pages should 'render with a layout similar to the normal site, but with bigger text and more contrasting colours'. I know you've advised that doing that would mean effectively designing a new CSS layout/design purely for the accessible versions of each page - please can we get a quote for redesigning the accessible versions of the pages? 3. Flash plug-in - there is an issue with the London 2012 logo/scrolling pictures on the home page in Internet Explorer. I think this is something to do with 'flash plug-ins', as this was the error message that came up when we loaded the site in Firefox at the ICE. Please can you explore and rectify? 4. Alt text on scrolling pictures - we need the alt text to show as a yellow box when hovering over the images so that people know where they are. I think you have said this will require a component/function adding so may have cost implications. Can we get a quote for this please? 5. Archaeology navigation - in order to get the nesting right (to mirror the site map) we had to lose the top level menu when you click on 'The investigations' and 'The sites'. This is not ideal, as it simply doesn't look great. What options do we have to amend/fix this? 6. Full list of publications - The project team want us to add an option on each theme page for a full list of publications per theme (ie a list of all micro reports, case studies, champion products and research summaries for Sustainability). Can we add a link, or another box for this? Would be great to go through the options and costs for this. 7. External links page - we would like to add in External Links for each theme page. I reckon there will be around five external websites for us to link out to, per theme. Maybe this could sit under the 'related links' on the right? Also would be great to discuss options. 8. Technical Overviews - we are publishing some technical overviews of the project, which are external papers that we just need to link to. Because these are overviews of the project, and not theme-specific, are we able to add a tab at the top, which takes you to a page about the overviews? It just needs to be a page, with information about three organisations delivering the overviews. 9. Case study summaries - there are a number of case studies being published by external organisations next year that we have the summaries/abstracts for. We need these summaries to go on the website with links to the full case studies/publishers. I suggest that these go under the case studies section, or we have another 'box' for case study summaries. However, these aren't documents to upload (as with case studies), so there will be no thumbnail and no physical PDF to link to. It will just need to be a generic image, with the summary/abstract to go into the text box next to the thumbnail, and the link will take you to an external website (rather than a PDF). Hope this makes sense? The only other catch is that the links won't be available until next year! Best to talk through this one! 10. LOCOG testing of the website - Colin Miller has been continuing to test the website since we've gone live and has picked up a few 'aesthetic niggles'. I have asked him to outline what these are and will get back to you ASAP. They are not expected to be extensive and I'm hoping we can fix these in-house. Hope this all makes sense. As suggested, let's catch up early next week and then get a lump-sum for all of these changes. I want to ensure that we are very clear from the outset and that you are paid for all the extra work you are doing. Hope you have a lovely weekend. Speak next week. Indy Rihal Marketing Manager Communications Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6457 Blackberry: +44 (0) 776 055 4135 Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place Canary Wharf London E14 5LN Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com Information owned by ODA Please delete if you are not the intended recipient

subject: Greenwich Park site -
description:
Hi all, 

The Greenwich Park team have given us an idea of which content they require to remain live on their site next year, and we anticipate that the content will need updating/editing during Games time. 

Would it be possible to see about making this site content manageable so we can make amends easily in the cms, rather than updating the html?

Thanks very much, 

Antonia

comments.value:
Hi all, 

The Greenwich Park team have given us an idea of which content they require to remain live on their site next year, and we anticipate that the content will need updating/editing during Games time. 

Would it be possible to see about making this site content manageable so we can make amends easily in the cms, rather than updating the html?

Thanks very much, 

Antonia
Antonia, this shouldn't be a problem, but can you give us more information about which content is needed for games time?

Hi Danny, 

I'll be able to let you know what is required exactly after I've had a meeting with the GP team next week. They are due a site refresh and one of their team is working on it at the moment so I'l give you a shout as soon as I know. 

Thank you

Hi Danny, 

Had a chat with the GP team and they said to assume that all existing content will bew needed for games time. I'm not sure if that helps you or not?! 

Thanks

Antonia

That's helpful

Just to clarify, we are talking about http://www.london2012.com/greenwich-park/

It could certainly be made content manageable.

The steps are more or less as follows:
- Identify the content requirements (which I think you have just done)
- adapt or amend the existing page layouts as required (assuming no redesign required)
- identify a new address (probably a sub-domain of london2012)
- identify a server for hosting the site
- agree a timetable
- setup a new CMS instance
- construct templates
- add content
- launch site

That's it for now.

subject: Content migration for games-time website
description:
Content likely to need migrating:
- media releases
- news stories
- blog entries
- publications
- photo pages
- video transcripts

Content likely to be treated separately:
- young leaders
- ODA planning team
- ODA jobs
- PDF journey planner
- ticketing website checker

Conference call with deltatre scheduled for Monday 17th.

Regarding the migration of content, we suggest that we do this as a web service, that can be accessed by deltatre as and when required.

I have attached a couple of examples of existing pages exported as XML, just as a starting point.

subject: Mobile Ads
description:
Hi,

We would like to implement ads on the mobile site.

We have a tentative go live date for this on the 4th of November.

We would like to place a banner ad at the top of the page.

The double click platform supports 4 different size creatives -
300x50
216x36
168x28
120x20

And automatically selects dependant on the device.

We'd like to discuss any issues this may present our current mobile site and will arrange a call for early next week.

Thanks,

Tom

Tom Price-Stephens
Assistant New Media Producer
